text:
Idea: Allow the creation of more than one variant for A/B testing a website page.  

Though it is a bad idea to run an experiment where multiple variables are tested against the control at once, the same can't be said for running multiple experiments concurrently where a single variable is tested against the control.  

Not even talking about Multi Variant Testing here... just want to run multiple experiments on the same page with low risk of interaction.
basic elaboration A/B/C/D test instead of just A/B
I read it as A/B … A/C … A/D test
I think we’re meaning the same thing, A being the control, B C D being variants
A/B, A/C, A/D is pretty accurate.  We're all on the same page though
^ I'd even be into the idea of creating module variants.  This would essentially accomplish everything I would like to do.
interesting idea ^^^^^
Maybe you didn’t mean this but it got me thinking of the ability to say “This module is A/B testable… and this field (or group of fields) can be A/B Tested)”
That would be excellent as well.  I'm always happy with any increase in the ability to A/B test

I know I have mentioned this a bagillion times, but can we get the "advanced menus" added to the nav menu under website? It's really the only thing missing from the menu that should be easily accessible and instead is hidden in either the settings area or hidden on the website pages  under more tools.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Would be nice to have that easily accessible since it’s one of the things we have clients muck around with.

There’s no page editor feedback channel so placing this here: <https://spin.d.pr/EAM0gD+>
The edit modules pane for a simple menu is really not awesome. needs work.
EZ fix for the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> :slightly_smiling_face:
I have a local one, I will push to the extension until HS take cares

let me know when you do this I can publish this right away. (or should this be part of v1.03 or 1.04)?

I feel like this should fall under the “ui tweaks” toggle that’s in v1.03
Would love a clone blog feature
And a blone clog feature while they’re at it.
lol wtf is a blone clog - when you use the can and some how manage to unclog a clog via bodily functions?
Oh man, when it happens, you’ll know it.
